ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Hotkeying out of EQ
ygData.msgSnippet: Of course the feature is nothing more of an annoyance to us non-cheaters who simply got to the character selection screen and forgot to un-mute the sound!
ygData.messageBody:
Of course the "feature" is nothing more of an annoyance to us non-cheaters
who simply got to the character selection screen and forgot to un-mute the
sound! Ahhhh damnit! I did it again! Esc...Esc...Esc...Esc...


At 06:30 PM 5/16/00 -0400, you wrote:
>This was disabled by verant. Some people figured out how to engage
>'Cheater' programs, and how to edit files to allow them capabilities not
>normally granted (lvl 1 caster with spells effects of a lvl 49 spell.
>.... Running 200 times faster than the fastest Bard, etc) .. This is
>the reason for the speed cap.
>
>The key strokes will now disable the EQ connection...
>I used it to research the web, but the strokes WERE....
>Ctrl+Alt+Del ... Choose 'Cancel' (You're in the desktop now)
>Do whatever you need to do...
>Click on the EQ tas in the task bar.
>
>If you did this, your desktop mouse cursor would remain visable, but you
>were unable to move it.
>
>Hope this helps.
>
>Banyon
>27 Hymns
>Bertox
>-SEMI- retired
>
>
>Peck White wrote:
>
>> Someone once posted a sequence of key strokes that would successfully
>> let
>> you hotkey out of EQ and back in. I can't find the post now and was
>> wondering if anyone here knows how to do it.
>>
>> Thanks in advance,
>>
>> Tomerrilin Loreweaver
